FuncDef:
The drop-timeout time-number command sets a timeout period for an MP interface to reassemble upstream MP fragments.
The undo drop-timeout command restores the default setting.
By default, the timeout period for an MP interface to reassemble upstream MP fragments is 100 ms.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a timeout period for an MP interface to reassemble upstream MP fragments.
The value is an integer ranging from 10 to 100, in milliseconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before an interface reassembles upstream MP fragments, run the drop-timeout time-number command to set a timeout period. The interface discards subsequent MP fragments after the timeout period expires.
